creator: nicolas.mailhot@laposte.net
text:
It seems patching the sources to add a --tag somewhere would work, but I'd
rather build from pristine apache sources

Making all in jni
make[1]: Entre dans le r�pertoire
`/home/nim/rpm/BUILD/jakarta-tomcat-connectors-jk-1.2.6-src/jk/native/jni'
/bin/sh ../libtool --mode=compile cc -I/usr/include/apache -O2 -march=i386
-mcpu=i686 -DHAVE_JNI -DEAPI -I /usr/lib/jvm/java/include -I
/usr/lib/jvm/java/include/linux -I../common -D_REENTRANT  -c jk_jnicb.c
libtool: compile: unable to infer tagged configuration
libtool: compile: specify a tag with `--tag'
make[1]: *** [jk_jnicb.lo] Erreur 1
make[1]: Quitte le r�pertoire
`/home/nim/rpm/BUILD/jakarta-tomcat-connectors-jk-1.2.6-src/jk/native/jni'
make: *** [all-recursive] Erreur 1

creator: nicolas.mailhot@laposte.net
text: Dunno if it's the right way to fix it, only thing I know it seems to work

Hi Nicolas (Jpackage power).

This patch is very strange, could you explain us what the --tag=CXX is required ?
creator: hgomez@apache.org
nicolas.mailhot@laposte.net
text:
This libtool brokenness, as far as I can say the patch is needed on RH 7.3 and
RH AS 2.1 but *not* on RHES 3.

Someone more familiar with libtool than me should look at it, there is certainly
a way to write the makefile.in so it works on all libtool versions:(

I must say just looking as this files gives me an headache

Well Jean-Frederic is our resident libtool expert and I hope he could take a
look at this
creator: hgomez@apache.org
jfclere@gmail.com
text:
fixed in configure.in : use the libtool we delivered with the tarball.
If you build from cvs then update your libtool, the one your using is broken.

creator: nicolas.mailhot@laposte.net
text:
Well I doubt people will be delighted to use a bundled binary either, but I
don't care that much after all this time
